name: People's National Bank of Pittsburg v. Duquesne Reduction Company, Appellant
name_abbreviation: People's National Bank v. Duquesne Reduction Co.

judges: Before Fell, Brown, Mestrezat, Potter, Elkin and Stewart, JJ.
parties: People’s National Bank of Pittsburg v. Duquesne Reduction Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Mestrezat,
The questions raised on this appeal were considered and determined in the opinion in The People’s National Bank et al. v. Liquid Carbonic Company, ante, p. 503, handed down herewith, and for the reasons there given the decree in this case is affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Mestrezat,

attorneys: T. Boy Dickie, with him Wm. W. Wishart, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
People’s National Bank of Pittsburg v. Duquesne Reduction Company, Appellant.
Argued Nov. 4, 1909.
January 3, 1910:
Appeal, No. 164, Oct. T., 1909, by defendant, from decree of C. P. No. 1, Allegheny Co., Sept. T., 1908, No. 616, on bill in equity in case of The People’s National Bank of Pittsburg and William T. Wallace v. Duquesne Reduction Company.
Before Fell, Brown, Mestrezat, Potter, Elkin and Stewart, JJ.
Affirmed.
J. A. Wakefield, for appellant.
T. Boy Dickie, with him Wm. W. Wishart, for appellees.
